definition: Lugou Bridge or Marco Polo Bridge in southwest of Beijing, the scene of a conflict that marked the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War 抗日戰爭|抗日战争[Kang4 Ri4 Zhan4 zheng1]
surname Lu/abbr. for Luxembourg 盧森堡|卢森堡[Lu2 sen1 bao3]
(old) rice vessel/black/old variant of 廬|庐[lu2]/(slang) (Tw) troublesome/fussy
ditch/gutter/groove/gully/ravine/CL:道[dao4]
bridge/CL:座[zuo4]
Marco Polo Bridge Incident of 7th July 1937, regarded as the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War 抗日戰爭|抗日战争[Kang4 Ri4 Zhan4 zheng1]

sentences.english: Lugouqiao hospital is an Olympic designated hospital.
sentences.chinese: 卢沟桥医院是奥运会定点医院。

sentences.english: For a time, the roaring guns of the resistance at Lukouchiao decided the issue.
sentences.chinese: 卢沟桥抗战的炮声，把这个争论暂时地解决了。

sentences.english: Located in the southwest outskirts of Beijing, Lugou Bridge spans the ancient Lugou River, hence the name of the Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 卢沟桥位于北京西南郊，因跨古卢沟河而得名。

sentences.english: Lugou Bridge was designed according to the feature of the currents of Yongding River.
sentences.chinese: 卢沟桥是根据永定河水流的特点设计的。

sentences.english: The lugouqiao incident broke out in 1937, the Japanese invading China.
sentences.chinese: 1937年卢沟桥事变爆发，日本大举入侵中国。

sentences.english: Lugou Bridge is also famous for its stone sculpting art.
sentences.chinese: 卢沟桥还以其精美的石刻艺术而闻名世界。

sentences.english: Many people try to count the member of lions on Lugouqiao Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都设法想数清卢沟桥上的狮子。

sentences.english: She lives near the Lugou Bridge, works in the North Third Ring Road.
sentences.chinese: 她住在卢沟桥附近，上班在北三环。
